result.post: virus (ZIKV) is a (re-)emerging virus that was originally

result.pre: the Americas [4]. To date, 84 countries or territories reported

result.pre: ZIKV transmissions [5]. Initially considered a harmless infection in humans,

result.pre: [8], and Guillain–Barré syndrome [9,10]. It is now established that
result.post: can be transmitted from mother to child during pregnancy,

result.pre: develop in up to 46% of the cases [12]. Thus,
result.post: infection poses a high risk for human health, as

result.pre: for human health, as vaccines and therapeutics are not available.
